action.content:
You are playing a negotiation game in which you have to agree on how to divide a set of items among you and another player.

Rules:
(a) You and the other player are given a set of items. Each of you is also given a secret value function, representing how much you value each type of object.
(b) You exchange messages with the other player to agree on who gets which items. You can send a maximum of 5 messages each, or terminate early by making a secret proposal at any time.
(c) You are each asked to submit a secret proposal indicating the items you want formatted in square brackets as follows: "[Proposal: <number> <object name>, <number> <object name>, <...>]"
(d) If your proposals are complementary, i.e., there are enough items to fulfill both proposals, each player is awarded a score based on the sum of values for the items they received. Otherwise, both of you get zero points.
(e) Your goal is to maximize the score you receive.

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

3 crayons, 1 chalk, 2 bolts

Your secret value function is:

crayon: 0, chalk: 0, bolt: 5

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.
action.label: context

action.content: Hi — nice to meet you. How would you like to split the items (3 crayons, 1 chalk, 2 bolts)? What do you value most among them?
action.label: response

action.content: continue
Hi — nice to meet you. How would you like to split the items (3 crayons, 1 chalk, 2 bolts)? What do you value most among them?

You are playing a negotiation game in which you have to agree on how to divide a set of items among you and another player.

Rules:
(a) You and the other player are given a set of items. Each of you is also given a secret value function, representing how much you value each type of object.
(b) You exchange messages with the other player to agree on who gets which items. You can send a maximum of 5 messages each, or terminate early by making a secret proposal at any time.
(c) You are each asked to submit a secret proposal indicating the items you want formatted in square brackets as follows: "[Proposal: <number> <object name>, <number> <object name>, <...>]"
(d) If your proposals are complementary, i.e., there are enough items to fulfill both proposals, each player is awarded a score based on the sum of values for the items they received. Otherwise, both of you get zero points.
(e) Your goal is to maximize the score you receive.

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

3 crayons, 1 chalk, 2 bolts

Your secret value function is:

crayon: 1, chalk: 3, bolt: 2

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.


Hi — nice to meet you. How would you like to split the items (3 crayons, 1 chalk, 2 bolts)? What do you value most among them?
action.label: context

action.content: Nice to meet you too! I value the chalk most, then bolts, then crayons. I'm flexible — what's important to you? Which items do you prefer and why?
action.label: response

action.content: continue
Nice to meet you too! I value the chalk most, then bolts, then crayons. I'm flexible — what's important to you? Which items do you prefer and why?
Nice to meet you too! I value the chalk most, then bolts, then crayons. I'm flexible — what's important to you? Which items do you prefer and why?
action.label: context

action.content: I prefer the bolts more than crayons or chalk. I'm flexible — would you like the chalk and some crayons while I take the bolts? How many bolts do you want?
action.label: response

action.content: continue
I prefer the bolts more than crayons or chalk. I'm flexible — would you like the chalk and some crayons while I take the bolts? How many bolts do you want?
I prefer the bolts more than crayons or chalk. I'm flexible — would you like the chalk and some crayons while I take the bolts? How many bolts do you want?
action.label: context

action.content: I can do that. I only need one bolt at most (they're worth 2 each to me). I'd like the chalk and maybe one or two crayons. If you're taking both bolts, would you be okay giving me the chalk and 2 crayons? That would give me chalk (3) + 2 crayons (2) = 5 value; you'd get 2 bolts (4) and 1 crayon (1) = 5 value — even split. If you'd prefer a bit more for yourself, we could do chalk + 1 crayon for me and you take both bolts + 2 crayons (I get 4, you get 6). Which do you prefer?
action.label: response

action.content: continue

action.content: I can take both bolts. I'll agree to give you the chalk and 1 crayon (so you get chalk + 1 crayon). That leaves me with 2 bolts and 2 crayons. Does that work for you?
action.label: response

action.content: continue

action.content:
That works for me. I'll accept the chalk + 1 crayon. I'll submit a proposal now.

[Proposal: 1 chalk, 1 crayon]
action.label: response

action.content: proposal
The other player has submitted a secret proposal. It is now your turn to submit a proposal of your own.
action.label: context
